sources.title: Grandma's Boy
sources.description: Title: Grandma's Boy Summary: A meek young man must find the courage within when a rogue tramp menaces his home town. Directed by: Fred C. Newmeyer Actors: Production Company: Hal Roach Studios Release Date: 3 September 1922 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.33 : 1 Always the mama's boy, or in this case a grandma's boy, Sonny joins a posse after a tramp accused of robbery and murder. He is unable to conquer his cowardice until Grandma tells him of his grandfather, also a coward, who overcame his fears with the help of a magic amulet. With new courage (and the charm), Sonny captures the fugitive and becomes the hero of the day.

metadata.Plot: Always the mama's boy, or in this case a grandma's boy, Sonny joins a posse after a tramp accused of robbery and murder. He is unable to conquer his cowardice until Grandma tells him of his grandfather, also a coward, who overcame his fears with the help of a magic amulet. With new courage (and the charm), Sonny captures the fugitive and becomes the hero of the day.
metadata.Writer: Hal Roach, Sam Taylor, Jean C. Havez
metadata.Actors: Harold Lloyd, Mildred Davis, Anna Townsend
